content.eamr: ( ing-5 "2 cups chopped walnuts or pecans" )

content.text: 0) In a large bowl, combine the sugar, flour, baking powder, salt, dates and nuts.
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "combine"@20:27 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "the sugar"@28:37 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "flour"@39:44 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "baking powder"@46:59 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "salt"@61:65 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-4 "dates"@67:72 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "nuts"@77:81 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-0-0 "a large bowl"@6:18 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 1) Add the eggs, butter and vanilla; stir just until dry ingredients are moistened (batter will be very stiff).
content.eamr:
( inst-1 / R
	:inform ( ac-1-0 "Add"@3:6 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-6 "the eggs"@7:15 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-7 "butter"@17:23 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-8 "vanilla"@28:35 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
	:inform ( ac-1-1 "stir"@37:41 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-1-0 "until dry ingredients are moistened"@47:82 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 3) Bake at 350 degrees F for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
content.eamr:
( inst-3 / R
	:inform ( ac-3-0 "Bake"@3:7 / AC
		:heat ( temp-3-0 "350 degrees F"@11:24 / TEMPERATURE )
		:duration ( dur-3-0 "20-25 minutes"@29:42 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-3-0 "until golden brown"@46:64 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 4) Cool bars on a wire rack.
